title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera -
description: Quiet place in a pine forest, to rest for a while or even spend the night. Only the cars on the road can be heard a little.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
description: Just the side of a lane with walkers and a few cars. Enough for small van. But great views of the cliffs at night. And amazing number of egrets in the trees on the little island. Probably over 100 roosting overnight.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 33 Calle Peña
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 33 Calle Peña
description: Parking place to spend the night with incredible views of the Castle. quiet and no traffic

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 59 Avenida del Santiscal
description: Small parking lot at the end of a dead end street.  Calm and pleasant.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 10-22 Calle Salida del Puente
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 10-22 Calle Salida del Puente
description: Parking with great views of Arcos de la Frontera. Without any service. Possible night off season. It can be complicated to turn around for long motorhomes.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 2 Calle República Dominicana
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 2 Calle República Dominicana
description: Gray and black water discharge services and drinking water to load, central area but easily accessible dinoverde car washes

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 5 Calle Pintor Francisco Bayeu
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 5 Calle Pintor Francisco Bayeu
description: Quiet parking at the end of a dead end at the lake. Very quiet, and without the traffic of the other 2 spots nearby ... In the middle of palm trees!

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Av. Duque de Arcos
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Av. Duque de Arcos
description: Large dirt parking without service. Ideal for visiting the beautiful village of Arcos de la Frontera. We did not spend the night, but it seems that the night parking is tolerated on this car park (according to other motorhomes).

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 6 Calle Pintor Goya
description: Small quiet parking with lake view. Close to other small car parks, without services. To date, no overnight accommodation problems.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera -
description: Before the other area with several reviews, directly opposite the farm by the river. We preferred to stay here as access was easier and the other area was full with 3 vans already. The area I can be quite busy during the day with families visiting.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Ramón Vázquez Orellana
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Ramón Vázquez Orellana
description: This small laundry is the only place in Arcos de la Frontera where you can have your clothes washed. The laundry is labeled "dry cleaning", but they also offer a normal laundry service. The next day we were able to pick up our freshly washed and folded clothes from the friendly señora. It is really recommended!

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 185 Avenida Sombrero de Tres Picos
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 185 Avenida Sombrero de Tres Picos
description: Quiet and free parking at the lake.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - C-334
description: A recreational area without services but perfect to rest and walk with a view of the town of arches of the border, many pines and very shady, it is not forbidden to stay overnight as there is no sign that prohibits it. next gas stations services.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Antonio y Carlos Murciano
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - 4 Calle Antonio y Carlos Murciano
description: Unpaved parking in front of the Bus Station. Passable road with large AC. Near other car parks visible on P4N. No problem to stay overnight, quiet area. We are in mid-November 2022. In twenty minutes on foot you can reach the historic center, full of history. Recommended.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - C-344
description: Private area of payment guarded and with perimeter fence, gate closed at night, paved, with water and electricity service. Good views of the town qda about 15 minutes by bike. Restaurant in the same area, good prices. Arches of the border. Very tourist town, castle, medieval churches and narrow alleys.  Call if the door is closed

name: Camping Lago de Arcos
title: (11630) Camping Lago de Arcos
description: Located in Arcos de la Frontera, Cádiz. Accessible and comfortable, close to the town, to all kinds of attractions and tourist attractions adapted to all tastes and ages. From a quiet walk to an afternoon of nautical activities on the lake, eating typical products or a hiking route. We offer offers in low season.

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Los Cabezuelos
title_short: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera - Los Cabezuelos
description: By the river (swimming possible) and very quiet. Little shade and a lot of rubbish unfortunately but perfect for the night. A herd of cow comes on the ground at sunset but does not stay long. Also suitable for large motorhomes but flat terrain limited to 3-4

title: (11630) Arcos de la Frontera -
description: Incredible views towards the Peña de Arcos, perfect place to park, motorhomes, etc. Very spacious, on both sides of the river.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
description: Free water tap at the beach. Quier if you come in the morning or at night. Cold shower also available.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 701 Avenida Príncipe de España
description: Quiet area, you can swim, artificial beach on the lake with spectacular views, with tables, WC, bar-restaurant. You cannot camp but you can spend the night, there is a campsite nearby.

title: (11638) El Santiscal - 8 Avenida Príncipe de España
title_short: (11638) El Santiscal - 8 Avenida Príncipe de España
description: Near the leisure and catering base, on line parking by the lake in a dead end. No prohibition sign.

title: (11640) Bornos -
description: In height in front of the lake exceptional sunrise for vehicles of 6m max to be able to turn around in the path not far from the city but in a quiet area beautiful walk to do on foot or mountain bike beware of the end of glass (Spain...)

title: (11640) Bornos - 37 Avenida de la Diputación
description: A nice place not very big, but people very friendly, forbidden to stay. You can swim in the lake.

title: (11640) Bornos - 37 Avenida de la Diputación
description: Free parking in front of the camping place. Flat and clean. Very bright during the night. Walking distance from the city. Much cleaner than the place next to this. Might be full in the summer though. Also toilets next to the place, but they are closed right now.

title: (11640) Bornos - 58 Calle Puerto
description: Quiet place in the urban area where you can park to visit the town or rest from the trip. There is no service of any kind, only garbage containers. Together Public school.

name: CAT Lake Bornos
title: (11640) CAT Lake Bornos
description:
ALWAYS CALL BEFOREHAND SINCE AIR SPORTS EVENTS MAY BE TAKING PLACE AT THE TIME YOU WANT TO STAY THERE ...

 Excellent & Tranquil Campsite on the shores of Lake Bornos, with spectacular views of the lake & distant mountains, and an amazing sunrise . Owner Francisco is really helpful & friendly. Starting point of walks, hikes , motorbike & cycling, kayaking from here, very good restaurants around the village of Bornos , Dia supermarket & gas stations. Special place to be for flying enthusiasts , ideal for paramotoring & powered trike flying, the campsite caters also as a powered paragliding school. Takeoff and landing spots just minutes away from campsite. Highly recommend if in the area or nearby...important to enter the road from Hermegas Bornos ( see attached pic) , ONLY easily accessible for motorhomes from that direction !

title: (11640) Bornos -
description: In front of the lake possibility of putting it in the shade sloping ground but you can dig easily and put calles not far from the city but it is very quiet (done with a van. to be tested for cc)

title: (11640) Bornos - 1 Plaza las Monjas
description: Ample place to park up to AC of 7 meters. Next to a square with a playground for children and a bar with a terrace. To spend the day I think nobody would tell you anything to park.

title: (11640) Bornos - 56 Calle Río Guadalete
description: drinking fountain

title: (11640) Bornos - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place with a view!!! Definitely worth it!!

title: (11620) Arcos de la Frontera - A-389
description: Filler neck for cooling water

title: (11640) Bornos - 51 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: The landscape is very beautiful - very narrow and sometimes poor access.

title: (11640) Bornos -
description: Lake spot by Bornos about 50 min Granada. Town 500m away with cafe etc and a beautiful free walked garden and town WiFi. Flat, lake and mountain view, walking around lake

title: (11620) Jédula -
description: The town hall has set up a loading and unloading point. Always use good judgment and leave it as you would like to find it. Keep in mind that the town festivals are on the first weekend of June, so those 2 weeks cannot be used.

title: (11620) Jédula - 13 Calle Beatriz Cáceres Castillo
description: To spend the night without problems, very quiet area. He has neither water nor electricity.

title: (11649) Coto de Bornos -
description: A tranquil semi flat plot on the banks of the Bornos lake accessible for campervan a who don’t mind veering off tarmacked roads and into nature. The lake may be full or, like in March 2023, looking rather empty. Otherwise a great place for kayaking or even swimming but you may have to walk to get to the waters edge if low water levels.  Very green in spring be ready to be ambushed by horses and cows . The view when you wake up is stunningly baby blue and green .  So, although this is not a camp site as such, there are no signs prohibiting camping or doing overnight stays. We have done so a few times and seems like this is tolerated……

title: (11648) Espera - 1000A Calle 1º de Mayo
description: Several car parks (4 or 5) between this point (2) and the castle. Calm and safe. You have to cross the town, so it will not be comfortable for ACs over 6.5m

title: (11639) Algar -
description: Very nice spot right on the water next to an old road that leads to the reservoir. The entrance to the square is blocked by a gate, but this only serves to keep the cows indoors in the surrounding fields. You can find out by reading the signs or asking the locals. Nobody was bothered by our presence here. So to close the gate behind you again! It could be that cows are walking around here, but we didn't see any.

title: (11580) San José del Valle - A-2201
description: Small place by the lake in San José del Valle

title: (11580) San José del Valle - 3A Avenida de la Independencia
title_short: (11580) San José del Valle - 3A Avenida de la Independencia
description: There is a tap with a long hose behind the gas station building. We asked and were allowed to fill up. There is enough space for large vehicles (my van is 6 meters long)

title: (11580) San José del Valle - 2 Calle Miguel de Cervantes
title_short: (11580) San José del Valle - 2 Calle Miguel de Cervantes
description: Municipal pool parking, for about 4 motorhomes. Quiet place in a typical village of Cádiz. It has a little inclination, but admissible. Surrounded by nature, and with drinking water less than 20m. in a children's park, from where a local 1km route begins.

title: (11570) Jerez de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
title_short: (11570) Jerez de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
description: La Suara recreation area, barbecues, quiet site, you can spend the night very quiet, ideal for walking or cycling.

title: (11580) San José del Valle - 14 Avenida de la Independencia
title_short: (11580) San José del Valle - 14 Avenida de la Independencia
description: Convenient fountain at the parking lot

title: (11639) Algar - 25 CA-6104
description: Gas station, kind owner allow to refull water tank for free

title: (11639) Algar - 39 Calle San José
description: Parking at the school. Close to the center and a playground.

title: (11580) San José del Valle - Km.14 A-2201
title_short: (11580) San José del Valle - Km.14 A-2201
description: Parking lot next to café

title: (11639) Algar -
description:
SANTA MARGARITA RURAL FINCA EL PIKETA. Private property with all services for AC. An ideal place to rest, enjoy nature and its animals. Spectacular views of the Guadalcacín reservoir. Pepe ElPiketa super caring and best professional. 10 points for Pepe.
Danger! Access to the farm works via a transponder for the gate. This transponder is located on the right side of the gate, in a mini safe with a numeric code.
You get the number code when you call Pepe.
Pepe's phone number or email address can be found under the menu item "Contact".
Of particular note are the shaded picnic areas and children's playgrounds, which are also shaded, the pool and the free-roaming horses and sheep.

title: (11580) San José del Valle -
description: Super quiet spot at the very top of San José del Valle, past the Camino de la Teja and the old cemetery. Please note that access is difficult! OK for a van in dry weather: climb in first gear on a stony path, otherwise 4x4. But once you arrive you will have a large flat space to park, with very nice views. Possibility to go up to the Cruz del Valle (but rather on foot or by bike, I think). Please keep the place clean!

title: (11650) Villamartin - 4 Calle detrás Jerez-Ronda
description: Parking on the outskirts of the town, near the sports center and the fairgrounds.

title: (11650) Villamartin - 55C Avenida de Arcos
description: Dirt parking at the entrance of Villamartin. Convenient for visiting the city center, 20 minutes on foot. Excellent typical sweets of the place. Next to it is a petrol station.

title: (11650) Villamartin - 55C Avenida de Arcos
description: Service station with AdBlue and LPG service as well as CEPSA bottles and car wash also for motorhome

title: (11650) Villamartin - 2 Calle Violeta
description: Gas Station with Repsol regular propane ( 11 kg size ) & butane gas cylinders available, opens from 6 am till 10 pm everyday

title: (11650) Villamartin - A-373
description: Parking next to the gas station. Toilets and water available. Ask at the gas station if you can stay. Close to the supermarket 5 minutes walk. Next to Villamartin.

title: () Algar - Unnamed Road
description: Place for a vehicle at the edge of a dirt road in the middle of nature. The small river on the side brings a great "zen sound" for the night. Not perfectly flat. There was a bigger place on the same road before, but families were already there and were organizing a small party.

title: (11650) Villamartin - CA-8101
description: Picnic area with toilets (not very clean) games for children ... Can be a place where we could spend the night (to be confirmed). We were just passing there.

title: (11660) Prado del Rey -
description: Very quiet place at the entrance to the Sierra de Cádiz, great amplitude next to a sanctuary.

title: (11650) Villamartín - A-384
description: Repsol station to collect water, and car wash services, propane cylinders

title: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - Camino de las Monjas
title_short: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - Camino de las Monjas
description: Very large picnic area, with many benches and tables and barbecue facilities. The terrain can be fully used. There are toilets, cold showers (closed at night) and water and trash cans.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - Km. 70 Autovía del Sur
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - Km. 70 Autovía del Sur
description: Emptying and filling service at BP gas station. This is in the Cádiz-Seville direction. In the other direction there is another point with the same services. I guess we'll have BP to thank for that. I wish all gas stations had the same idea.

title: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - Km. 70 Autovía del Sur
title_short: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - Km. 70 Autovía del Sur
description: Just a normal service / gas station along the Autovia del Sur in direction South to Cadiz. Motorhomes can fit, they have toilets and a little shop. No fuzz but doable when in need.

title: (11592) - 65 Lugar Ds
description: This site is the general car park for Jerez Grand Prix circuit. It is massive and we spent a very quiet night here by ourselves. No noise, no disturbances at all. No amenities, just a flat piece of gravel and weeds car park.

title: (11400) El Cuervo de Sevilla -
description: A quiet little corner, quiet, by the side of the road.

title: (41749) El Cuervo de Sevilla -
description: Double car park of the Laguna Tollón Bird Observatory - Mirador la Mina. At the top we have a beautiful view but there is a very slight slope, and at the bottom there is a second flat parking lot. Both are gravelled and easily accessible. Depending on the direction of the wind you can hear the AP4 motorway a little but nothing disturbing. Please keep this place clean!

title: (11400) Nueva Jarilla -
description: Natural park reservoir Parking

title: (41749) El Cuervo - 15 Calle Francisco Trujillo
description: On our way Gibraltar to Portugal we found this empty but very nice Laundrette.  There’s parking round the square

title: (41749) El Cuervo - 35b Calle Fernando Cámara Gálvez
title_short: (41749) El Cuervo - 35b Calle Fernando Cámara Gálvez
description: 24-hour self-service laundry

title: (41749) El Cuervo de Sevilla - 30 Sc Suo
title_short: (41749) El Cuervo de Sevilla - 30 Sc Suo
description: Excellent caravan washing area, with two stair bridges for cleaning the roof.

title: (41749) El Cuervo - 1 Avenida de Nuevas Tegnologias
title_short: (41749) El Cuervo - 1 Avenida de Nuevas Tegnologias
description: PUBLIC MOTORHOME AREA OF EL CUERVO DE SEVILLA. FILLED D CLEAN, EMPTY D GRAYS AND BLACKS AVAILABLE. PICNIC AREA AND VARIOUS PLACES FOR OVERNIGHT AND REST. LIGHTING AT NIGHT. CLOSE TO THE NATIONAL IV. THANKS TO THE CITY COUNCIL OF EL CUERVO DE SEVILLE. INDUSTRIAL AREA AND FAR FROM THE POPULATION NUCLEUS. TOWN WITH GOOD GASTRONOMY AND BAKING TRADITION. NEGLECTED SURROUNDINGS

title: (41749) El Cuervo - 7 Calle Emilia Pardo Bazán
title_short: (41749) El Cuervo - 7 Calle Emilia Pardo Bazán
description: Residual streets of a small and cozy town with good gastronomy and good combination. Lighted and quiet area. I advise buying village bread. I recommend

title: (11670) El Bosque - Canada de Villamartina
description: Recreational area, with picnic tables and barbecues. It is not well cared for and there is some garbage, but it is a quiet place, with a lot of shade and with the forest river right here. Easy access by a dirt track in very good condition. Only local people walk, it is not an area full of tourism like others around, that's why we liked it. Let's keep this beautiful and accessible space clean.

title: (11593) Jerez de la Frontera - Carretera Cortes
title_short: (11593) Jerez de la Frontera - Carretera Cortes
description: We stayed here over the Saturday to Sunday weekend and arrived late. Nothing was going on, so we easily found a place for our camper (7.20m). The access to the place is very easy to drive. Unfortunately, the street is very close and very busy. There were slight noises (discotheque?) to hear.

title: (41749) El Cuervo - Avenida del Progreso
description: Undeveloped industry fallow ... Quiet for one night.

title: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 104 CA-31
title_short: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 104 CA-31
description: Service station with water and hose plug. It has a restaurant nearby too.

title: (11670) El Bosque - Calle Rafael Alberti
description: Parking near children's park. Parking along the roadway. Almost no traffic. On Sunday a little parking of vehicles that visit the museum of cheese "El Bosqueno". Quiet place, lighted and well placed to visit the city.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 8 Calle Juan Ramón Jiménez
title_short: (11670) El Bosque - 8 Calle Juan Ramón Jiménez
description: A parking space before the bridge, flat parking, very little passage, this is not the ideal spot but we were quiet for one night.

name: Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
title: (11670) Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
title_short: (11670) Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
description: I have been coming to this town, since I have great friends here, even before being a caravanner. Having an overnight area here is wonderful. There are neighbors who don't see it well and after being here for a few days I have verified that sometimes we have what we deserve. I have been able to verify how, despite the fact that there is a place designated for dumping, there were buses going here that, while they were parked, opened valves and gradually dumped, the ones with a gasoline generator set, they had it running late at night, bothering the the neighbors and other caravaners. Let's have civility please, so we will have more opportunities and places, and we will be better seen and treated. Congratulations on the app.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 18 Calle Benamahoma
description: Good place to spend the night in the forest, quiet place

title: (11670) El Bosque - 15 Poligono del Anden
description: Drinking Water Supply for free

title: (11670) El Bosque - 1 Avenida Diputacion
description: Parking area in the village for about 20 AC. Park for children and walk. Quiet starting at 00h. Close to typical shops and areas to eat and near the beautiful path of the Majaceite river towards Benamahoma

title: (11670) El Bosque - 30 Calle los Perales
description: Parking on the street. It is level. Very quiet place to spend the night. Nothing is heard, only the sound of a nearby river. When we arrived there were several Ac and Campers staying overnight. Recommendable.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 15 Calle Jaen
description: We did not sleep here but I believe it is possible without any problems. park to right side of road. we only posted up during the day. In quiet area away from town and homes, opposite a natural reserve with a natural stream with small beach to relax. A good hiking trail departs from this section also. fairly flat parking space for 1-2 small vans. Less flat space for more. great 4G reception and just 3 mins from pueblo El Bosque. not ideal for bigger campers. the hostel that you park next to is currently closed, to your benefit. drinking water fountain right there

name: Camping la Torrecilla
title: (11670) Camping la Torrecilla
description: A very familiar and beautiful place, views of nature and tranquility. The owners are very friendly, affordable price.

title: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - 27 A-4
description: Possibility to wash the mobile home

title: (11670) El Bosque - 102 Diseminado los Catorce
description: A picnic area with a couple of relativity flat spots for a motorhome 2km outside El Bosque. The parking is mainly on a hill is sandy and rocky. There are public toilets here also. There are no services only bins. We seen people fill their water bottles from the running stream. There are two entrances with low branches at the first so go to the second. There is a house across the road and a rooster may wake you early.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 16 Camino del Espino
description: Parking at the start of the hike. A very quiet place without outside light. At the edge of a river in 1 min and a half. Road with potholes for the last 300 meters. I stayed there all day and all night (no sign indicates prohibition) 4min by car you are at a Bar / Restaurant at the edge of the water (easy parking space)

title: (11670) El Bosque - Camino del Castillejo
description: Botanical Garden Parking

title: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 20 Calle Guadalmedina
title_short: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 20 Calle Guadalmedina
description: Park Strip! A bus stop nearby. There are bars, hardware stores and very close churros. Calm. Next to the cemetery. 5 minutes from the racetrack. Free. There is no water. There are dumpsters.

title: (11670) El Bosque -
description: Go up to see the sunset, with a friend. And I saw that there is space to park motorhome or peasant and be able to spend a stay outdoors in nature

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 10 Carretera Ds
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 10 Carretera Ds
description: Two small parking spaces near the lagoon of the Medina. Just off the road, there is a sound barrier to protect the lagoon that leads to a beautiful hiking trail.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 33 Avenida Tio Pepe
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 33 Avenida Tio Pepe
description:
Private area LA MORADA DEL SUR with all the services for motorhomes: repair shop, accessories store, rest room, snack machines, laundry, 24h video surveillance and personnel.
The price includes: electricity, water, gray water drainage and Wc, toilets with showers, Wi-Fi.
Bus right in front of the city center, restaurants and shops next door.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 1D Avenida de Arcos
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 1D Avenida de Arcos
description: This was a great parking spot for our kids to enjoy this amazing park.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 69 Calle Marcelino Camacho
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 69 Calle Marcelino Camacho
description: Quiet street at night, hardly any traffic, but after half past six cars begin to pass by. the width allows you to park motorhomes well and it is not safe to find space for one of more than seven meters. bars very close for coffee in the morning.

title: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 32 Calle Ávila
title_short: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 32 Calle Ávila
description: We spent one night in the parking lot. everything was fine. Again and again a few people on the road until after midnight, regularly individual cars, but everything was very peaceful. if you don't mind, it's an ideal place to stay for a night. Breakfast is served at DESAYONOS ANDRÉS.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Francisco Riba
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Francisco Riba
description: Level ground parking and next to playground and several restaurants. Supermarket at 50 meters. There is no service, but to spend a quiet night is perfect.

title: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 33 Calle Rosa Duran
title_short: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 33 Calle Rosa Duran
description: Quiet parking lot in a side street on the edge of a park.

title: (41719) Guadalema de los Quinteros - CA-31
description: Resting place in the shade of eucalyptus trees, tables and benches to use. We took a refreshing nap in the afternoon.

title: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - A-381
description:
Restaurant service station, sink, showers, WC, parking and gas station, very good music, bakery 24/24.
The car park is not so noisy. For showers you can get the key in the restaurant. At the restaurant the food is excellent.  There is water also. Wifi free and excellent.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 4 Avenida la Pepa
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 4 Avenida la Pepa
description:
Laundromat, open all year, easy parking next to the hypercor, bars nearby.

Very clean with ceiling fan and TV

title: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - Unnamed Road / Estación Servicio Alegría
title_short: (11400) Jerez de la Frontera - Unnamed Road / Estación Servicio Alegría
description: Respol - service station with water

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 21 Avenida Lola Flores
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 21 Avenida Lola Flores
description: It is a wide-to-access avenue, with a park with many trees. In front there are good places as coffee shops, pubs and bars. At night it's quiet and safe. Good place to spend the night. Percentroot. There is a merchandise and a Carrefour and also the football stadium chapín, where the Xerez sports sport FIS. In the cafeteria Alfredo Café Cupas you have free WiFi.

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - A-375
description: Quiet picacho.Endroit recreation area stuck to the road, but with minimal traffic. BBQ area and children's area. Perfect for making beautiful walks (the climb to the summit is recommended).

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - A-375
description: Picnic area next to the road with an embankment to park just before the recreation area of the Picacho trail. It does not have easy access and there is little flat space. We spend the night quietly in summer (August). In the morning some cyclists and motorcyclists making a route along the road. Quite good for one night and making the climb to Mt.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 1 Calle Andorra
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 1 Calle Andorra
description: Quiet parking day and night, attached to sports facilities with fountain (skatepark, basketball, calisthenics and beach volleyball) free Silent at night, with shade trees, without bottles or gorillas. Quiet spot, free and water nearby

title: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 22 Calle Mozart
title_short: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 22 Calle Mozart
description: Parking aside the supermarket

title: (41710) Utrera - N-480
description: Asphalted parking with delimitation for motorhomes and trucks of the sale El Paisano. Upgrade with non-potable water tap (well) for filling and at the same place three drains for black drainage. The grid for the grays has not been put to today. It's along the highway, at night there is little traffic and enough trucks at night, that's for sure. The store has many typical products of the region. Thank you for the services.

title: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 103 Calle Enrique Granados
title_short: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 103 Calle Enrique Granados
description: We spent a quiet night here. The parking bay is on a slope, but at the highest point we stood pretty straight with two mobile homes. Ideal for children because there is a really great playground in the adjacent park. Likewise, a dog training area, where there are two water taps. We could watch the locals filling up water there to drink. In the village there is a super delicious pizzeria called "Pizzaburger Mario" Great value for money and super tasty.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 7 Plaza los Pinos
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 7 Plaza los Pinos
description: Nice place. Nice neat neighborhood. Night forbidden.

title: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 5T Calle Nuestra Señora de la Consolación
title_short: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 5T Calle Nuestra Señora de la Consolación
description: Excellent parking, quiet even at night, clean, close to the University of Jeréz de la Frontera. There are no services. We spent two nights without anyone disturbing. In 30 minutes on foot you can reach the historic center.

address.street: 5T Calle Nuestra Señora de la Consolación

title: (41760) El Coronil - A-375
description: Beginning of the greenway seen from the port of Serrano and Olvera Coripe, free parking, few places to van or small motorhome given the limitation of space and the presence of sun roofs at some places.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Avenida Chema Rodriguez
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Avenida Chema Rodriguez
description: Stabilized parking in front of the sports complex of Jesez de la Frontera. No worries about spending the night there, unlike the other parking lot offered by the application, which is located in a closed parking lot at night.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 11C Calle Miguel de Unamuno
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 11C Calle Miguel de Unamuno
description: Quiet parking. Very spacious. 800 meters from the center. without services. Near a gas station with a self-service washing machine, and a Mercadona, opposite a hospital.

title: (11679) Benamahoma - 1 Calle la Venta
description: Quiet place ideal for overnight and hiking trails, bar attached to the parking.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 1C Avenida de la Ilustración
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 1C Avenida de la Ilustración
description: Parking outside Jerez, but with a good combination to get to the city center, there is a norauto and a supeco that have it all, a bit noisy early in the morning as it is a crossroads, there is also a close bar in front of Fiat which is a great price of quality

title: (11679) Benamahoma - 26 Calle la Venta
description: Renowned fountain. Fresh water of quality. The inhabitants supply themselves in large numbers. Easy access by road.

title: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 8 Calle Federico Chueca
title_short: (11406) Jerez de la Frontera - 8 Calle Federico Chueca
description: Very calm and tree-lined dead end, small park where people come to walk their dogs at the end of the dead end. I spent one night there with no problem.

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 0 Calle Martín Ferrador
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 0 Calle Martín Ferrador
description: Gas station with laundry

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 5 Calle Jorge Bocuze
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 5 Calle Jorge Bocuze
description: Free parking 15 minutes walk from the city center. Quiet and shady corner in the afternoon. Near the Lustau winery in Jerez

title: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Pablo Neruda
title_short: (11405) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Pablo Neruda
description: A specifically appropriate place to visit the city. 10 min walk to the center. Relatively quiet at night.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 12 Avenida del Tamarix
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 12 Avenida del Tamarix
description: Residential street, quiet and close to the headquarters of the local police for the area. To walk to the city from here is about 30 minutes. I recommend getting a taxi.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 4D Plaza Marte
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 4D Plaza Marte
description: Ideal parking for visiting the city. Far from being a dream place but practical to spend the night there, clay. Suitable for HGV or coach.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 1 Calle Velázquez
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 1 Calle Velázquez
description: Parking of the indoor pool. Very quiet and safe place in a residential area. The center is 20 minutes walk.

title: (41740) Lebrija - 30 Avenida del Cuervo
description: Municipal sports car park. It has some shadow. Between HOSPITAL COMARCAL and POLIDEPORTIVO, with the services/facilities that they offer. Bar restaurant nearby. Ideal for a night on the road to Sevilla Sanlucar Barrameda

title: (41740) Lebrija - 34 Avenida del Cuervo
description: Great laundry room, open until 10:00 p.m. There is enough parking space in front of the salon. The laundry smells very good after washing!

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 5D Avenida María Auxiliadora
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 5D Avenida María Auxiliadora
description: Parking to visit the city: take the exit on the left Avenida de Carrascal. Ideal for cycling, cycle paths everywhere. To do the Mercato (closed at 2 p.m.), horse riding center, bodegas, cathedral, Alcazar, etc. Too noisy for the night in our opinion.

title: (41740) Lebrija - 71A Avenida José Fernández Ruiz
description: Tap with water at gas station

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 8 Avenida Duque de Abrantes
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 8 Avenida Duque de Abrantes
description: Parking next to the MERCA 80 shopping center. Quiet and spacious. Sunny. Very close to the Equestrian Art School. The urban center 20 minutes on foot. Supermarket, bakery, Asian bazaar, hardware store, hairdresser, optician, etc ... Places for breakfast and tapas. Brewery, Italian restaurant, kebab. Gas station, sale of butane and possibility of filling with water. Empty ask Very busy from Monday to Friday from 9.30 am by the Tax Office and courts. It is free again from 2.30pm. THURSDAY partially prohibited by the market from 7 to 15 hours.

name: Camping Los Linares
title: (11679) Camping Los Linares
description: Large camping. Very clean and organised. 50 + camp/ motorhome pitches. Warm douches very quiet in mid season. Friendly staff. Swimming pool.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 1D Calle Fermín Aranda
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - 1D Calle Fermín Aranda
description: Quiet residential street, surrounded by nature and orange trees. We made juices in the morning.

title: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - Calle Antonio Machado
title_short: (11407) Jerez de la Frontera - Calle Antonio Machado
description: Quiet street in front of a park. We spent the night and without problems. 15 min from the center of Jerez. There is a nearby bar for breakfast.

title: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - Autopista del Sur
title_short: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - Autopista del Sur
description: Ideal rest area to spend the night. Picnic area and games for children. 24 hour gas station

title: (11407) Jerez - 4 Calle Doctor Fleming
description: Free outdoor car park near the city center. Ideal for visiting the city and at night.

title: (41740) Lebrija - 118 Calle Corredera
description: Street to park camper or motorhome of 6m without problem. Very close to the town square.

title: () Grazalema - A-372
description: Recreational area in meadow with tables and barbecues, very wide. Sand parking area.

title: (41740) Lebrija - 42 Avenida Nervión
description: Gas station, where there are Cepsa and Repsol bottles and opposite to wash the motorhome

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera Andalusia - 10 Diseminado Poligono 1
title_short: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera Andalusia - 10 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Good car park to take a walk to Pico del Aljibe. Stood here during the day. There are no signs that staying overnight is prohibited. Parking lot is fairly level with waste containers.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle de Muleros
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle de Muleros
description: Unpaved parking, very close to the center, and quiet. We slept there a couple of nights at Christmas and it was great. no problem.

title: (41740) Lebrija - 2 Avenida Océano Atlántico
description: El Recreo, 24-hour car wash area

title: (41740) Lebrija - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in earth, in front of Ermita Park of San Benito north of Lebrija. A little passage during the day (walkers and cars that roll slowly: there are speed bumps) but otherwise it's quiet. Accessible to large units. Beautiful park, with main entrance at the end of the road. No services on site.

title: (41740) Lebrija - 56 Avenida Antonio Calvo Ruiz
description: Repsol gas station with butane and drinking water

title: (11404) Jerez de la Frontera - 5D Avenida los Liños
title_short: (11404) Jerez de la Frontera - 5D Avenida los Liños
description: Residential area, near the center, bus stop, supermarkets, ideal for Easter 1 km from the fair. We recommend. Antoni bar, good prices, homemade food, dog park 100 meters away

title: (11404) Jerez de la Frontera - 3 Calle del Barril
title_short: (11404) Jerez de la Frontera - 3 Calle del Barril
description: Parking next to the old town. My 6 meter camper van just about fit in. Right next door is another parking lot, also for rather small mobile homes or vans.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 35C Calle Taxdirt
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 35C Calle Taxdirt
description: Car park near the town centre. Small play park and grass area behind. Less than 5 mins to town. Free. No services. Didn't stay the night but could have, quiet area. Just a car park, but close to town and possible for long vehicles to overhang.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - C. José Manuel García Caparros
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - C. José Manuel García Caparros
description: Parking next to the Pedro S. Garrido stadium in Jerez de la Frontera, we spent a night with a little noise until 10pm. but at night it is very quiet BE CAREFUL ON MONDAYS IT IS THE MARKET and you cannot park.

title: (11170) Cádiz - Polígono Industrial el Machorro
description: A urban area not finished.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 14 Calle Calzada del Arroyo
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 14 Calle Calzada del Arroyo
description: Parking in the street, next to the founding vineyard. It is very central, the cathedral to 750 m. We stop only to visit.

title: (41740) Lebrija - Av. Vicente Aleixandre
description: Big public parking at the railway station, very quiet to spend the night or to leave your Motorhome and travel on the train

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera -
description:
Little corner of paradise in a territory completely lacking in bivouacs!
very easy access for all vehicles.
In the shade and in the company of a few cows in the neighboring field.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Marcelo Villalobos
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Marcelo Villalobos
description:
15 minutes from the old center. In a residential area in absolute calm.
Perfect and quieter than around the nearby park. Ideal van.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 9 Diseminado la Carretera
description: Place to spend the night and visit the town on foot. Noisy, since it is the entrance and exit of the town and many cars pass by. We were interested in this place because we go to the Ubrique rally climb every year, and it is very, very close to see the rally stage. If you are a fan, it is a good place to spend the days of the rally.

title: (11170) Medina-Sidonia - 27 Diseminado Venta Angeles
description: Gas station with special laundry for motorhomes and trucks.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 10 Calle Armas de Santiago
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 10 Calle Armas de Santiago
description: Large free parking to visit the city. Probably

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 33 Calle Historiador Bartolomé Gutiérrez
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 33 Calle Historiador Bartolomé Gutiérrez
description: We tried all the places near Tio Pepe winery on Friday morning (around 10am) and it was impossible to find a spot. Here we are 1km far from the entrance (and also from the historic center) and there is plenty of space for more campers. Green area, calm place (besides being on the street), flat, cyclopath near. We don’t know if it’s safe, but we didn’t see any danger.

title: (11600) Ubrique - s/n Carretera Ubrique - Benaocaz
description: Parking next to the Roman ruins of Ocuri. With spectacular views and a bar right next door, with breakfast and meals and family atmosphere.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - Calle Juana Aguilar Pazos
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - Calle Juana Aguilar Pazos
description: Good place day and night

name: Estación de Servicio Repsol

description: Parking with water charge and discharge just behind the gas station in their own facilities.

title: (41740) Lebrija - 17 Calle Acantilado
description: Parking at the Family Cash, very spacious and quiet

title: (11600) Ubrique - 6 Diseminado la Carretera
description: Parking next to road

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 38 Calle Arquitecto Hernández Rubio
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 38 Calle Arquitecto Hernández Rubio
description: Parking with a 7,5t at the calle Arquitecto Hernández Rubio (minimum traffic here, but beware of the mini catolic church - here is little noisy people going inside and outside), but this place is very good and we sleep here with no problem, park is full of dog-walkers, near (1km) is the bigger shops and centrum is about 15 minutes of walk.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 1 Carretera de Benaocaz
description: Parking with a bit of a slope, but spectacular views of Ubrique

title: (41740) Lebrija - 37 Calle Caleta
description: Ecological washing center for motorhomes with Cepsa cylinders

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Madreselva
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 2 Calle Madreselva
description: Parking for coaches, allowed for motorhomes only the day until 22h.

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules -
description: Place to rest, nearby there is a store, municipal swimming pool, etc. I don't know if you could spend the night.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 9998 Calle Escritor William Shakespeare
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 9998 Calle Escritor William Shakespeare
description: Good parking area where to spend the night. Well connected and close to some lagoons where you can take a walk.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 1 Calle Sebastián Macías
description: Day parking behind the bullring. Closed overnight 22.00-09.00

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - CA-5032
description: Relatively flat parking lot of the municipal swimming pool. Without services (in winter). Despite being next to the road, it is quite quiet. Ideal to spend the night and visit some nearby hiking trails.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - Calle Orfebre Alonso Moreno
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - Calle Orfebre Alonso Moreno
description: Large parking near department stores and a MacDo. Perfect to reach on foot (10 mn) the sites to visit. No security problem, store space and parking under surveillance! Bins all sort! Used by day, but can also be used at night (see truck (s) ...)

title: (11600) Ubrique - 2 Calle Harana
description: Newly refurbished motorhome parking area with black & grey disposal plus fresh water. No EHU. Narrow street to access & steep final access road, anything >8m not likely to manage. Lovely views over pretty town & hills. Lots of cafes & bars a few minutes walk away. Supermarket nearby. **tuesdays area used for large market so no access until late afternoon**

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 641 N-IV
description: Carrefour shopping center. drinking water at the service station next to the vacuum cleaner. The hose is suitable for filling! Excellent! Thank you Carrefour!

title: (11600) Ubrique - 6A Avenida Juan de la Rosa
title_short: (11600) Ubrique - 6A Avenida Juan de la Rosa
description: Source of drinking water

title: (11600) Ubrique - 54 Avenida de España
description: Self service laundromat within walking distance of RV parking lot Adre is Av. Spain 34.

title: (41731) Marismillas - Calle Ferrocarril
description: In Marismillas, large parking lot on the edge of the village overlooking the fields (made of cotton if we stop) Small village built in the square. Amazing. quiet place, some barking from dogs and crows from roosters, nothing very annoying. overnight stay prohibited

title: (11600) Ubrique - 36 Calle Fernando Gavilán
description: Quiet parking Beautiful views

name: Sierra laundry
title: (11600) Sierra laundry
description: Lavendria Sierra laundry with modern machines. Parking on site may be difficult, but 600m away from official camper parking. Nice village to walk around when waiting for your laundry to finish.

title: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 6 Calle Puerta del Verano
title_short: (41730) Las Cabezas de San Juan - 6 Calle Puerta del Verano
description: Shady picnic area that can be very suitable for a quiet night.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 25D Avenida de Italia
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 25D Avenida de Italia
description: Fabulous place near the center of Jerez to spend the day, surrounded by green areas, very quiet.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - s/n Ronda Aurora Boreal
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - s/n Ronda Aurora Boreal
description: Area located in the best area of Jerez de la Frontera. With all the services you can imagine. Highly recommended for children because there is everything, cinema, bowling, karting, lego park, jumping, pirate ship ... zoo and cellars very close. They rent cheap 125cc motorcycles to tour the city. Bus stop at the door.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - Rda. Aurora Boreal
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - Rda. Aurora Boreal
description: Parking for the day. Next to the motorhome area. Very quiet and big.

title: (41730) Sacramento - 2 Calle Puerta del Verano
description: A local showed us that he was sleeping in this place and differs considerably from the pace recorded 200 meters before. In addition to the picnic tables under the pines, it also has a connection to the water and toilets.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 17 Calle San Francisco
description: Water fountain

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - 21b Calle Fernando III el Santo
title_short: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - 21b Calle Fernando III el Santo
description: Small parking lot 10 minutes from the town center. Approximately 40 cars, quite busy. The sites are quite fair for motorhomes and large campers.

title: (11408) Cádiz - 1 Ronda Aurora Boreal
description: Parking near the Orchestra store. In a huge commercial area. Petrol station, restaurant, food, bus to Downtown. One can be noisy until 22h. The vehicle of the security company patrols every hour.

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - 50 Paseo de la Playa
title_short: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - 50 Paseo de la Playa
description: Nice town to visit and eat its typical products of the town. In the Mix and Flavors store in Alcalá (you have everything). On the beach promenade there is a candy bar that makes highly recommended homemade potato chips.  The village pool is away from the center, you can park well and the price is affordable.

title: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 1Z Avenida de Rota
title_short: (11408) Jerez de la Frontera - 1Z Avenida de Rota
description: Dead end street and therefore quiet to rest and continue.

title: (41719) El Palmar de Troya -
description:
Following a rocky road you arrive at a flat space next to the lake. The location is surrounded by trees and wild growth. Great camping spot.
I came with a small van, would not recommend it for motorhomes, the other side of the lake has more accessible spots though.
A few children came by in the evening (saturday) but otherwise very few human sounds

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - 1X Carretera Algeciras
title_short: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - 1X Carretera Algeciras
description: Fairground to park and sleep for free, two minutes from the town ..

title: (11600) Ubrique -
description: I don't know how to classify this place, it doesn't have any services, other than a Picnic area nearby, it is accessed by a dirt road, and there is a long road and a lot of places to park. In the mornings quite a lot of people pass by but we did not have any problem, quite quiet and close to many places to see or to start excursions.

title: (41710) Utrera - Unnamed Road
description: Related to the neighboring spot. Just to show that there is really a lot of space here. LTE partially available.

title: (11170) Medina-Sidonia - 1I Calle los Acebuches
description: Parking lot at sports field

title: (11170) Medina-Sidonia - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place behind the popular gardens of Medina Sidonia to camp high up and away from traffic (which you can hear from afar). Access by a sloping unpaved road full of ruts, not passable in rainy weather (unless you are a 4x4 pro or you are traveling with your enduro / mountain bike). It also doesn't seem very accessible for large units, even if there is space once on site. Icing on the cake: for the moment there is no waste here so thank you for keeping it that way!

title: (41710) Utrera - Unnamed Road
description: Place in the middle of nature facing the lake, do not hesitate to walk along the paths, several spots, picnic table. No regulatory height and flat land 1 hour from Seville.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 27 Diseminado Bujeos Altos
description: Beautiful picnic area, spacious with sun and shade. No facilities but bins.

title: (41719) Utrera - 49 Urbanizacion la Cañada
description: At the foot of the torre de l'Aguila. The climb is difficult (reserved for 4x4 or intrepid van) but the view absolutely splendid. Upstairs there is a small bench where you can spend the night. Below the lake there is another place where you can go if there is too much wind at the top.

name: Camping Medina Sidonia
title: (11170) Camping Medina Sidonia
description: Camping, Medina Sidonia bungalows. Kindness on all four sides, very attentive and doing great.

title: (11612) Benaocaz - 7 Calle Pajaruco
description: Quiet area, lighting, no traffic, flat, ideal for one night. Next to restaurants, hiking trails...... Unobstructed mountain views with beautiful sunsets. no shadow SAT ok.

name: Camping Los Gazules
title: (11180) Camping Los Gazules
description: Camping Los Gazules

title: (11170) Medina-Sidonia - 5 Calle Portería
description: Quiet place with spectacular views, we spent the night without any problem

title: (41770) Montellano - 62 Calle Morón
description: Water fountain easy to fill the van with.

title: (11170) Medina-Sidonia - 47 Plaza del Punto
description: Petrol station happy to let us have drinking water from a hose housed in their air/water point. We did buy fuel.

title: (41719) Guadalema de los Quinteros - 20 Calle Cementerio de Guadalema
title_short: (41719) Guadalema de los Quinteros - 20 Calle Cementerio de Guadalema
description: Place to stay in a quiet village. Ideal for a break on the N4 between Seville and Cadiz. Outdoor municipal swimmimg pool.

title: (11170) Medina-Sidonia - 14P Avenida del Atlántico
description: 2 flat car parks one tarred and marked on the ground the other underneath chippings unmarked places were first went to that a little higher and left cars skidding. On gravel and sloping we changed and found this quiet place .
